subprocess_flow.description: Development teams begin writing code based on the user stories and tasks defined in the iteration plan. This involves adhering to coding standards, utilizing appropriate design patterns, and implementing the necessary functionality to meet the acceptance criteria. Developers work collaboratively, often using pair programming or code reviews, to ensure code quality and knowledge sharing.
subprocess_flow.purpose: To implement the features and functionalities defined in the iteration plan.
end_conditions: Code development complete for all tasks

step_risks_and_controls.control: Daily stand-ups and clarification with product owner

subprocess_flow.description: Developers create and execute unit tests to verify the correctness of individual components and functions. This involves writing test cases that cover various scenarios, including positive and negative cases, boundary conditions, and error handling. Unit tests are automated and integrated into the CI/CD pipeline to ensure continuous feedback on code quality.
subprocess_flow.purpose: To ensure the correctness and reliability of individual code components.
triggers: Code development complete for a component
end_conditions: Unit testing complete for all components

step_risks_and_controls.control: Code coverage analysis and test case review

subprocess_flow.description: Integrated code changes into the shared repository. This involves resolving conflicts, merging code branches, and ensuring that the integrated code builds successfully. Continuous integration practices are followed to automate the integration process and provide rapid feedback on integration issues. The System Team may be involved to assist with environment provisioning and build automation.
success_criteria: All unit tests pass after integration
subprocess_flow.purpose: To combine code changes from multiple developers into a single, working codebase.
end_conditions: Code integration complete and build is successful

step_risks_and_controls.control: Frequent integration and automated conflict resolution tools
Automated build verification and rollback mechanisms

subprocess_flow.description: The integrated codebase is subjected to system testing to verify that the system as a whole meets the defined requirements and acceptance criteria. This involves executing test cases that cover various aspects of the system, including functionality, performance, security, and usability. The System Team often assists with setting up the test environment and providing test automation support.
subprocess_flow.purpose: To validate that the integrated system meets the defined requirements and acceptance criteria.
end_conditions: System testing complete and all critical defects resolved

step_risks_and_controls.control: Thorough test case design and execution
